block.p: Tenley Elisabeth Reed, a daughter of Sally Foreman-Reed of Greenwich, Conn., and John S. Reed of New York, was married yesterday at her father's house in Princeton, N.J., to David Jason Ross, a son of Deborah and Roger Dale Ross of Spring, Tex. The Rev. Dr. Martin E. Marty, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Reed, 25, is keeping her name. She graduated from Georgetown University. Her father retired as co-chairman and co-chief executive of Citigroup, the financial services organization in New York. He is a member of the board of managers at the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center and a member of the operating board of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The bride is a stepdaughter of Cynthia Leigh Reed.

Tenley Elisabeth Reed, a daughter of Sally Foreman-Reed of Greenwich, Conn., and John S. Reed of New York, was married yesterday at her father's house in Princeton, N.J., to David Jason Ross, a son of Deborah and Roger Dale Ross of Spring, Tex. The Rev. Dr. Martin E. Marty, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Reed, 25, is keeping her name. She graduated from Georgetown University. Her father retired as co-chairman and co-chief executive of Citigroup, the financial services organization in New York. He is a member of the board of managers at the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center and a member of the operating board of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The bride is a stepdaughter of Cynthia Leigh Reed.

Mr. Ross, 27, is an associate in New York with the high-yield bond department at Deutsche Bank. He graduated from the University of Texas at Austin. His father is the chief executive of US Oncology, a medical-practice management company in Houston.
The couple met in 1991 as students at the Berkshire School in Sheffield, Mass.
